intro: Nepeta granatensis, commonly known as the granate catmint, is a flowering plant native to the Balkans and parts of southern Europe. It is characterized by its aromatic, fuzzy leaves and clusters of small, pale blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and flowering plants. Nepeta granatensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant fragrance.
